newsitem.title: USA: Lancaster Colony buys Chatham Village.
newsitem.headline: Lancaster Colony buys Chatham Village.

text.p: Lancaster Colony Corp said Friday it bought private Chatham Village Foods Inc for an undisclosed amount of cash.
Lancaster said the acquisition included Chatham's brand of salad croutons, which has about $20 million in annual sales.
"We have an on-going interest in growing our specialty food business through good-fitting acquisitions such as Chatham Village," said chief executive John Gerlach in a statement.
Lancaster's food goup produces Marzetti, Cardini, Girard's and Pfeiffer brand salad dressings, and other foods.
Lancaster posted a net income of $21.0 million on revenues of $218.1 million in the first quarter, compared with a $17.8 million net on revenues of $200.5 million the year before.
The company's stock traded unchanged at 52-1/4 Friday afternoon, close to its 52-week high of 53-1/4.
